   156â†’            const scrollTop = window.scrollY;
   157â†’            const docHeight = document.documentElement.scrollHeight - window.innerHeight;
   158â†’            const scrollPercent = scrollTop / docHeight;
   159â†’
   160â†’            // Map 0-70% scroll to 0-100% of the animation (inverted)
   161â†’            const animationProgress = 1 - Math.min(scrollPercent / 0.7, 1);
   162â†’
   163â†’            // Maximum offset is 50% of viewport width (completely off screen)
   164â†’            const maxOffset = window.innerWidth * 0.5;
   165â†’            const offset = animationProgress * maxOffset;
   166â†’
   167â†’            leftHalf.style.transform = `translateX(-${offset}px)`;
   168â†’            rightHalf.style.transform = `translateX(${offset}px)`;
   169â†’
   170â†’            // Transition to black at 98% scroll
   171â†’            if (scrollPercent >= 0.98) {
   172â†’                document.body.style.background = 'black';
   173â†’                document.documentElement.style.background = 'black';
   174â†’                leftHalf.style.opacity = '0';
   175â†’                rightHalf.style.opacity = '0';
   176â†’                centerText.style.opacity = '0';
   177â†’                finalContent.style.opacity = '1';

   179â†’                document.body.style.background = 'white';
   180â†’                document.documentElement.style.background = 'white';

   182â†’                rightHalf.style.opacity = '1';

   184â†’                finalContent.style.opacity = '0';

_**Agent (claude-opus-4-5-20251101)**_

<think><details>I see the issue. On line 41, the image is referenced as:

```css
background-image: url('../green_transparent_hsv.png');
```

The path `../green_transparent_hsv.png` means it's looking for the image one directory up from where the HTML file is. 

There are two problems:
1. The image file `green_transparent_hsv.png` isn't in the repository - it wasn't committed
2. Even if it was, the path `../` goes up one directory level, which on Vercel would be outside the deployed directory

So the image isn't showing because:
1. The image file wasn't included in the git repo/deploy
2. The relative path `../` points outside the project directory

Let me check if the image exists locally.</details></think>

_**Agent (claude-opus-4-5-20251101)**_

The image path on line 41 is:
```css
background-image: url('../green_transparent_hsv.png');
```

Two problems:

1. **The image file isn't in your repo** - `green_transparent_hsv.png` wasn't committed. It exists one directory up (`../`) on your local machine, but that parent folder wasn't pushed to GitHub.

2. **The path goes outside the project** - `../` points to the parent directory, which doesn't exist on Vercel's deployment.

**Fix**: Copy the image into your project folder (the LIGHT directory) and change the path to `url('./green_transparent_hsv.png')` or just `url('green_transparent_hsv.png')`.

_**User**_

how can we have https? just tell me

---

_**Agent (claude-opus-4-5-20251101)**_

<think><details>The user is asking about how to get HTTPS for their Vercel deployment. They just want information, not for me to do anything.

Vercel provides HTTPS automatically for all deployments. If they're using a custom domain, they may need to configure it properly.</details></think>

_**Agent (claude-opus-4-5-20251101)**_

Vercel provides HTTPS automatically for all deployments - no setup needed.

- **Default `.vercel.app` domains**: HTTPS works out of the box
- **Custom domains**: Vercel auto-provisions SSL certificates via Let's Encrypt when you add a domain in your project settings

If you're having HTTPS issues with a custom domain, you just need to add/configure the domain in Vercel's dashboard under Project â†’ Settings â†’ Domains.

_**Agent (claude-opus-4-5-20251101)**_

<think><details>There's a conflict - the remote has changes we don't have. I need to pull first, then push. Let me do a git pull with rebase to integrate the changes.</details></think>

_**Agent (claude-opus-4-5-20251101)**_

Tool use: **Bash** Pull remote changes and push

`cd "/Users/calvinbeighle/Bridge Intelligence/LIGHT" && git pull --rebase && git push`

error: cannot pull with rebase: You have unstaged changes.
error: Please commit or stash them.

_**Agent (claude-opus-4-5-20251101)**_

<think><details>There are unstaged changes (the index.html was modified). I need to stage and commit those first, then pull and push.</details></think>

_**Agent (claude-opus-4-5-20251101)**_

Tool use: **Bash** Amend commit with new changes, pull and push

`cd "/Users/calvinbeighle/Bridge Intelligence/LIGHT" && git add . && git commit --amend --no-edit && git pull --rebase && git push`
